intro: Cerastium gracile var. kebdanense, commonly known as the Kebdanense mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, alpine environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plantings. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
